title: [BUG] Remove improvedTimeOps setting because if gets unix_timestamp wrong for 1970-01-01 time
body:
**Describe the bug**
unix_timestamp gets wrong int for 1970-01-01 time when set `spark.rapids.sql.improvedTimeOps.enabled` as true

**Steps/Code to reproduce bug**
```
$SPARK_HOME/bin/pyspark --master local[*] \
--jars ${SPARK_RAPIDS_PLUGIN_JAR} \
--conf spark.plugins=com.nvidia.spark.SQLPlugin \
--conf spark.rapids.sql.enabled=true \
--conf spark.rapids.sql.explain=ALL \
--driver-java-options '-ea -Duser.timezone=UTC '

>>> from datetime import datetime
>>> import pyspark.sql.functions as f
>>> df = spark.createDataFrame([(datetime(1970, 1, 1),), (datetime(1970, 1, 1),)], "ts_col timestamp")
>>> df.select(f.unix_timestamp(f.col("ts_col"))).show()
+-------------------------------------------+                                   
|unix_timestamp(ts_col, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss)|
+-------------------------------------------+
|                                     -28800|
|                                     -28800|
+-------------------------------------------+

>>> spark.conf.set("spark.rapids.sql.improvedTimeOps.enabled", "true")
>>> df.select(f.unix_timestamp(f.col("ts_col"))).show()
+-------------------------------------------+
|unix_timestamp(ts_col, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss)|
+-------------------------------------------+
|                                     -28799|
|                                     -28799|
+-------------------------------------------+
```

**Expected behavior**
`improvedTimeOps` config should not impact result.

**Environment details (please complete the following information)**
 - Environment location: [Standalone]
 - Spark configuration settings related to the issue

**Additional context**
The days other than 1970-01-01 can get correct result.
When the day is 1970-01-01 and `improvedTimeOps` is true, then discrapency occurs.
